intro: Blepharis pinguior, commonly known as the silverleaf bluemouth, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant produces blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically silver-green, covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Blepharis pinguior is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to full sun conditions.
